column2: As a user my buffered video is saved to the video server
column14: Build a video pre-buffer receiver proxy/server that receives the post to the endpoint. It should then save the file to S3 to be ready for splicing the buffer and video content.  Note: should be able to expand current sinatra app for this purpose, but estimate assumes that we will have to create something entirely new
column21:
Note for testing:
Until https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/70509170 is implemented, cameras must be manually configured with the correct prebuffer settings. See that story for the deets. (Andrew Cross - May 14, 2014)
column74: Sinatra app to receive HTTP POST
column78: Write to correct S3 bucket as ‘batch_0'
column80: Verify that playback of recorded video with pre-buffer as ‘batch_0’ will include prebuffer
